Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________________________. Sample 1: n = 8, mean = 18, sd = 3.4. Sample 2: n = 6, mean = 24, sd = 6.9. To test whether the population averages are equal we use the pooled T test; the test size here has a value of 2.155. For the corresponding two-sided P-value then applies

Answerlist
----------

* P < 0.01
* 0.01 < P < 0.05
* 0.05 < P < 0.10
* P > 0.10

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P < 0.01: Incorrect
* 0.01 < P < 0.05: Incorrect
* 0.05 < P < 0.10: Correct
* P > 0.10: Incorrect
